summary: Douglas Durham was an informant for the FBI within the American Indian Movement (AIM). The documents provided relate to the Senate Select Committee (SSC) investigation into intelligence activities, and Durham's name appears in the context of FBI personnel and information sharing agreements. The documents indicate that the FBI was monitoring individuals and providing materials to the SSC, and Durham's role as an informant was relevant to the investigation.
significance: Based on the provided documents, Douglas Durham's significance lies in his role as an FBI informant within the American Indian Movement (AIM) during the period investigated by the Senate Select Committee (SSC). The documents do not indicate any connection to the JFK assassination.
